alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 3:22PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Carbon, Monroe and northern Northampton Counties through 400 PM EST... At 321 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Freeland, or 8 miles northeast of Hazleton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Jim Thorpe, Pen Argyl, Nesquehoning, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Weatherly, Belfast, Tatamy, East Bangor, Stormville, Pocono Pines, Lake Harmony, Tannersville and Long Pond. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 75 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
